issue.title: Fix virtual headers symlink action for C++ headers

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
The virtual headers action should be executed when `strip_include_prefix` attribute is not `None`, because the `.` attribute values are resolved to empty string, which is a valid value.

The virtual haeders action should be independent from the original header path and include path to support library target definitions at any `BUILD` file with any project layout.

Fixes #26537 
Fixes https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/25339

body: I have one possible fix in #26538 which is working, please let me know your thoughts.
I'm wondering: Why are you using `#include <prefix/foo.hpp>` instead of `#include "prefix/foo.hpp"`? Wouldn't that be the expected include of in-project headers?

I want to use includes with angle brackets.
It's not about the C++ code, it is about consistency. The same code is working when I am moving the files to different folders or subfolders.

issue.title: Bazel refuses to create virtual includes if `include_prefix` matches repo-local path, but also doesn't propagate in-repo include path

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
### Description of the bug:


I have a C++ library which is located at `Foo/` relative to my repo root. All includes are done as `#include <Foo/Bar.h>`. Bazel doesn't want to do `-I<root>` to expose the entire repository for includes, which is understandable. However, even when I specify `include_prefix = "Foo"`, it doesn't create virtual includes under `bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/bin/Foo/_virtual_includes/Foo/Foo`, which means other packages depending on this package are unable to include headers with `<Foo/Bar.h>` paths.

Setting `include_prefix` to any other path, like `include_prefix = "Fooo"`, creates virtual includes which can then be referenced; it is only the exact path of the library itself that fails.

Setting `includes = [".."]` causes Bazel to refuse the path because it would expose the entire repository to all consumers of this library:
```
Error in fail: attribute includes: '..' resolves to the workspace root, which would allow this rule and all of its transitive dependents to include any file in your workspace. Please include only what you need
```

### Which category does this issue belong to?

C++ Rules

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


Reproducer: https://github.com/sin-ack/bazel-include-repro

Simply run `bazel run Bar` to exhibit the error. There appears to be no way to make the `Foo/Foo.h` include work.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


GNU/Linux

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.4.2

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


_No response_

### What's the output of `git remote get-url origin; git rev-parse HEAD` ?


```text

```

### If this is a regression, please try to identify the Bazel commit where the bug was introduced with bazelisk --bisect.


_No response_

### Have you found anything relevant by searching the web?

Similar issue, but `.` doesn't work as I must include the path instead of importing directly as `#include <blah.h>`: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/17039

### Any other information, logs, or outputs that you want to share?

_No response_

issue.title: [7.7.0] Fix virtual headers symlink action for C++ headers

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
The virtual headers action should be executed when `strip_include_prefix` attribute is not `None`, because the `.` attribute values are resolved to empty string, which is a valid value.

The virtual headers action should be independent from the original header path and include path to support library target definitions at any `BUILD` file with any project layout.

Credits to original author @spektrof.

Fixes #26537.
Fixes #25339.

Closes #26538.
